Project Description: It is known to be unusual for residential units to change their rooftops to BIPV skylight.
Along the roads of Jalan Bumbong, there is a resident whose house partially depends on skylight PV for energy to power their house.
The Tampinese Grande buildings are known for the Facade adn Roof BIPV. They have been awarded the LEED Gold Award for their green innovation.
The Tampinese Grande buildings are known for the Facade adn Roof BIPV. They have been awarded the LEED Gold Award for their green innovation.
AIST Tokyo waterfront is managed to integrate scientific and engineering knowledge to address socio-economic needs.
BCA has PVs retrofitted to its existing buildings. Having installed solar panels in many areas of the building will help the building achieve 100% clean renewable energy.

Bedok Mall, located in the east of Singapore, is a great example of a skylight BIPV. With how it is being designed and built, it not only helps to produce energy but also saves cost when it comes to natural lighting.
The BIPV that is located in the BIOPOLIS is a facade BIPV. It is made by a special glass module on the facade through a test bedding project.

Following a career of passive house demonstration this firm dedicated this project to being a nZEB with an RES. Late in the project planning phase a suggestion was made ot alter the facade to include BIPV, as the roof was not available. This proved successful in fundraising. As this was an early BIPV project the municipality was hesitant to award permission for the new facade based on unknowns in the glass, fire, and electrical safety standardization of the components. However it was agreed upon to be installed under close coordination between all teams. The BIPV was integrated into the curriculum of the school as a learning element and is featured in an all black finish that is apparaent from afar but not necessarily obvious as solar panels. The modules are effecticley back-ventilated cladding.
Project Lessons: - The BIPV was added later in the design process and therefore suffers from soe self-building shading.  - Unclear regulations stifled progress at times and due to this being a new type of component the tendering process and pricing was unclear. - Without clear fire regulations the local fire team trained on the system to understand how it and similar installations may need ot be addressed. - Custom modules and various sizes complicated pricing.

Project Description: The Business Investment & Consultant Building is known to the first ever BIPV building that has been built in Japan. It was built in 1998.

Project Name: City Hall of Hyogo (Kobe City Hall)
Project Description: The building consists of of Facade BIPVs which acts as shading devices.
The CleanTech One is an example of a skylight BIPV where it can harvest up to a capacity of 230kWp.

The inclusion of BIPV was insisted upon by one member of the board that oversaw the project. The school was initally designed ot include a metal facade system that was supposedly cost comparable with BIPV whihc made convincing other board memebrs of the BIPV worth. The BIPV elements are all fixed but with different tilt thus leading to inevitable shading. This is minimized with a micro-inverter system that is stored in the plenums for easier access. There was a time when the system was sending too much to the grid and the utility needed to shut it down. The North facade is covered in panels, but not connected to the system and meant to serve as a bank of replacement.
Project Lessons: - A BIPV advocate needs to be consistent throughout the project or it may dissapear. - Shading and partial shading can be overcome to optimize aesthetic over performance. - Utilties may hinder the overall performance if not prepared to receive generated electricty. - Clear and comfortable site and installation area access is key to faster and less error-prone installations.

Project Description: First ever building constructed incorporated the Building-Integrated Photovoltaics. In Europe this is the largest PV facade. The main feature of the building is of course the façade. The Façade is 66m long and it covers 532m^2.

Constructed in 2008 this new construction facility features two rows of PV and glass elements for each building level. The facade design was optimized to allow for daylight to move throughout the office space from the southern facade.
Project Lessons: - BIPV should not be evaluated solely on investment cost. - Integrating the BIPV design into the building design process does not necessarily mean you will have to make signifiacnt tradeoffs anywhere in the building. - Details are very significant in the final performance of the facade systems. - More public funding for research should be provided to realize projects like this.

Project Description: The PVs located on South Beach Tower are an example of a Roof BIPV.

Note: Rating is 40 and Generation with roof is 119000

Project Description: The Harbourfront Centre Theater is a signifiacnt attraction in Toronto, and well known throughout Canada. The building was built in 1926 as a place for massive ice blocks to be stored after being harvested from Lake Ontario. In 1986 the space was originally repurposed into a theatre. Near the time of the latest retrofit the exterior curtain system was failing. The BIPC curtain wall was integrated into the new triple-glazed facade and designed to match the art installation (or vice-versa).
Project Lessons: - Inverter solutions are not flexible enough for small systems. - Working with utilties that are not knowledgeable in PV or BIPV can delay projects significantly.

Project Description: Daito University consists of Facade and Skylight BIPVs. It's transparency is high as it allow huge amount of sunlight to shine through. This not only reduces the usage of electricity to power light, but provides natural sunlight
The Itoman Cityhall is an advantage as its location is ideal to harvest energy as it is located on a plot of land with no other buildings or structures blocking the building.

Project Lessons: - Electrical design becomes much more complex once another orientation is included in the system. - Back ventilation or cooling of the panels will improve efficiency greatly. This should not be done if the aesthetic will be comprimised.

Onyx Solar® has been entrusted to provide the building with a touch of originality by integrating a double skin of photovoltaic glass in the form of a mosaic, which is superimposed on the façade. The 315 amorphous silicon glass modules, measuring 500 mm x 700 mm (1.6 x 2.3 Ft), have a degree of transparency of 20%, enabling the uniform passage of light into the building and thus reducing the need for artificial lighting. This is a 4.1 kWp installation, generating approximately 3,400 kWh per year

Note: builder: fachhochschule potsdam location: potsdam architects: ortner +ortner baukunst year: 2011 module surface: 146qm performance: 195wp/modul building dimensions: 34,85 x 7,35m module size: 3900x 1050x13mm module weight: ca 190kg fixing system: linearly supported, embedded modules in the mounting frame in esg-h panels. electronic concept: low-voltage concept with parallel-connected super cells, serial-connected modules

Project Description: Located downstream from Ile Seguin on the Seine in Paris, the Cité de la Musique is an auditorium and a show room. The purpose of this building to promote everyone’s access to music. The auditorium, located on the Seine, is decorated with a large photovoltaic sail of more than 1000 m². A system mechanics around the auditorium makes it follow the sun.

In Cyprus, solar power panels are usually installed with a single type plan configuration. However, in the context of the present project, Onyx Solar photovoltaic glass has been installed on the façade of the building integrating the photovoltaic installation in the same construction structure.

for solar power, the building will incorporate 1000sqm if photovoltaic glass that are manufactured by Onyx Solar. The four Façade of the building will implement Onyx Solar amorphous silicon glass with transparency degree XXl and with 6 different colours

Solar Modules that has been made to install on the building, it actually supplied 20% of the building’s electrical power. Photovoltaic has multiple functions.
